DOC.detailed_description: The current proposal plan implement evaluate secondary suicide intervention skill train program ( gatekeeper training ) medical school student Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada . The main objective current proposal evaluate effectiveness gatekeeper training program , Applied Suicide Intervention Skills Training ( ASIST ) , improve medical student ' intervention skill suicidal patient compare train usual . Secondary aim include comparison change knowledge , perceive competence attitude around suicide . Findings previous study demonstrate significant positive effect gatekeeper training suicide prevention attitude , skill knowledge . As well , general study medical education reveal student able practice , observe , receive feedback small group show improvement skill confidence give didactic teaching . Therefore , investigator anticipate ASIST train program significantly improve medical student ' knowledge suicide intervention , increase recognition response suicide risk compare education usual . The investigator also expect ASIST training help understand impact attitude suicide prevention , increase perceive competence ability recognize treat suicidal individual compare train usual . It hypothesize medical student trained ASIST differ significantly ability correctly recognize intervene suicidal individual base use standardized suicide intervention model objective assessment use standardized patient .
